policies.name: Patch Management Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy governing the identification, testing, and deployment of security patches and updates
policies.rationale: NIST 03.14.01 requires 'install security-relevant software and firmware updates within organization-defined time period' which necessitates formal policy establishing timelines and procedures

policies.name: Vulnerability Management Policy
policies.description: Policy defining how system flaws and vulnerabilities are identified, reported, and remediated
policies.rationale: Control requires 'identify, report, and correct system flaws' which needs policy-level guidance on vulnerability lifecycle management

procedures.name: Vulnerability Assessment and Reporting Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for scanning systems, identifying flaws using CVE/CWE databases, and reporting to security personnel
procedures.rationale: NIST requires organizations to 'identify systems affected by announced software and firmware flaws' and 'report this information to designated personnel'

procedures.name: Patch Testing and Deployment Procedure
procedures.description: Process for testing patches in non-production environments, approving for deployment, and installing patches within defined timeframes
procedures.rationale: Discussion states 'Some types of flaw remediation may require more testing than other types' requiring documented testing procedures

procedures.name: Emergency Patch Procedure
procedures.description: Expedited process for deploying critical security patches when vulnerabilities pose immediate risk
procedures.rationale: Control allows 'time periods for updating may vary based on criticality of the update' requiring different procedures for critical vs. routine patches

executionEvidence.name: Monthly Vulnerability Scan Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: systems scanned, vulnerabilities identified by CVE/CWE number, CVSS scores, affected systems, remediation status, risk acceptance decisions
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates ongoing 'identify' requirement; monthly frequency aligns with CIS Control 7.2 recommendation for internal vulnerability scans

executionEvidence.name: Patch Deployment Status Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: patches released by vendors, criticality ratings, deployment deadlines (per organizational time periods), actual deployment dates, systems patched, exceptions/deferrals with justification
executionEvidence.rationale: Proves 'install security-relevant software and firmware updates within organization-defined time period' is being met

executionEvidence.name: Patch Testing Results
executionEvidence.description: Documentation of patch testing showing: patch tested, test environment details, test results, approval/rejection decision, date approved for production
executionEvidence.rationale: Discussion notes different flaw types require different testing; documents due diligence before deployment

executionEvidence.name: Vulnerability Remediation Tickets
executionEvidence.description: Helpdesk/ITSM tickets showing: vulnerability identified, CVE number, affected systems, assigned owner, remediation actions taken, closure date
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates complete lifecycle from identification through 'correct system flaws' as required by 03.14.01.a

operationalActivities: Subscribe to security bulletins from vendors, CISA, US-CERT, and CVE databases
Perform monthly vulnerability scans on all systems
Analyze scan results to identify affected systems and prioritize by CVSS score
Report identified vulnerabilities to information security personnel within 24 hours of discovery
Test patches in non-production environment before production deployment
Deploy critical patches within 30 days (or organization-defined period)
Deploy high-severity patches within 60 days (or organization-defined period)
Deploy moderate/low patches within 90 days (or organization-defined period)
Document and obtain approval for patch deployment exceptions or deferrals
Track patch deployment status and maintain metrics on compliance with timeframes

policies.name: Malicious Code Protection Policy
policies.description: Policy governing the deployment, configuration, and maintenance of anti-malware solutions across the organization
policies.rationale: NIST 03.14.02 requires 'implement malicious code protection mechanisms' organization-wide which necessitates policy-level direction

policies.name: Endpoint Security Policy
policies.description: Policy defining security requirements for endpoints including antivirus, real-time scanning, and response to malware detection
policies.rationale: Control requires protection 'at system entry and exit points' and 'at endpoints' requiring policy coverage for all access points

procedures.name: Antivirus Deployment and Configuration Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for installing, configuring, and maintaining antivirus software on all systems with required scan frequencies and response actions
procedures.rationale: Control requires specific configuration: 'perform scans at organization-defined frequency' and 'configure mechanisms to block/quarantine malicious code'

procedures.name: Malware Signature Update Procedure
procedures.description: Process for ensuring antivirus signatures are updated automatically as new releases become available per configuration management policies
procedures.rationale: NIST 03.14.02.b explicitly requires 'update malicious code protection mechanisms as new releases are available in accordance with configuration management policies'

procedures.name: Malware Detection Response Procedure
procedures.description: Process for responding when malicious code is detected, including blocking, quarantining, alerting administrators, and investigating incidents
procedures.rationale: Control requires organizations to 'block malicious code, quarantine malicious code, or take other mitigation actions in response to malicious code detection'

procedures.name: False Positive Management Procedure
procedures.description: Process for investigating and resolving false positive detections to minimize impact on system availability
procedures.rationale: Rev 3 adds new requirement: 'Address the receipt of false positives during malicious code detection and eradication and the resulting potential impact on availability'

executionEvidence.name: Weekly Antivirus Scan Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: systems scanned, scan completion status, malware detected (by type), threats blocked/quarantined, systems requiring attention, scan coverage percentage
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates 'perform scans of the system at organization-defined frequency'; weekly scanning aligns with CIS Control 10.1 recommendations

executionEvidence.name: Real-Time Protection Status Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: systems with real-time scanning enabled, signature version currency, systems with outdated signatures, disabled protection alerts
executionEvidence.rationale: Proves 'real-time scans of files from external sources as files are downloaded, opened, or executed' is operational organization-wide

executionEvidence.name: Malware Detection and Response Logs
executionEvidence.description: Logs showing: malware detected (type and signature), affected system, detection timestamp, action taken (blocked/quarantined/alerted), administrator notified, remediation outcome
executionEvidence.rationale: Documents execution of configured response actions: 'block malicious code, quarantine malicious code, or take other mitigation actions'

executionEvidence.name: Signature Update Compliance Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: current signature version, systems with current signatures, systems with outdated signatures (>24 hours old), automatic update success rate
executionEvidence.rationale: Proves compliance with 'update malicious code protection mechanisms as new releases are available' per configuration management policies

executionEvidence.name: False Positive Investigation Reports
executionEvidence.description: Documentation of false positive investigations showing: detection details, investigation findings, whitelisting actions, impact assessment, resolution
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates organizational process to 'address the receipt of false positives' as required in Rev 3 enhancement

operationalActivities: Deploy antivirus software to all endpoints, servers, and system entry/exit points
Configure antivirus for weekly full system scans
Enable real-time scanning for all file downloads, opens, and executions
Configure automatic signature updates (daily or as released)
Set antivirus to automatically block/quarantine detected malware
Configure administrator alerts for malware detection events
Monitor antivirus deployment coverage and remediate gaps within 24 hours
Review malware detection logs weekly for trends and anomalies
Investigate and resolve false positives within 48 hours to minimize availability impact
Maintain central management console for enterprise-wide antivirus monitoring

policies.name: Security Intelligence and Threat Management Policy
policies.description: Policy governing the receipt, review, dissemination, and response to security alerts, advisories, and directives
policies.rationale: NIST 03.14.03 requires organizational processes to 'receive' external alerts and 'generate and disseminate internal' alerts which necessitates policy-level guidance

policies.name: Information Security Policy
policies.description: High-level policy addressing organizational commitment to staying informed of security threats and sharing threat intelligence
policies.rationale: Control requires ongoing engagement with external organizations (CISA, NSA, FBI, ISACs) and internal communication requiring policy framework

procedures.name: Security Alert Monitoring and Review Procedure
procedures.description: Process for subscribing to external alert sources, monitoring incoming alerts, reviewing for organizational relevance, and prioritizing response
procedures.rationale: Control requires 'receive system security alerts, advisories, and directives from external organizations on an ongoing basis' requiring systematic monitoring process

procedures.name: Internal Security Alert Generation Procedure
procedures.description: Process for creating internal security bulletins based on external threats, organizational incidents, or identified vulnerabilities
procedures.rationale: NIST 03.14.03.b requires 'generate and disseminate internal system security alerts, advisories, and directives, as necessary'

procedures.name: Security Directive Implementation Procedure
procedures.description: Process for evaluating security directives, determining organizational impact, implementing required changes within timeframes, or notifying issuing organization of non-compliance
procedures.rationale: Rev 3 adds requirement: 'implement security directives in accordance with established time frames, or notify the issuing organization of the degree of noncompliance'

executionEvidence.name: External Alert Subscription Confirmations
executionEvidence.description: Documentation showing: active subscriptions to CISA alerts, US-CERT advisories, FBI notifications, vendor security bulletins, ISAC memberships, subscription renewal dates
executionEvidence.rationale: Proves 'receive system security alerts from external organizations on an ongoing basis' - confirms information channels are established and maintained

executionEvidence.name: Monthly Security Alert Review Logs
executionEvidence.description: Logs showing: alerts received, source organization, alert priority, relevance assessment, action taken or waived, responsible personnel, review date
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates organizational process for reviewing external alerts; discussion notes 'compliance with security directives is essential due to critical nature'

executionEvidence.name: Internal Security Bulletin Distribution Records
executionEvidence.description: Records showing: internal bulletins generated, distribution list, dissemination date, acknowledgment receipts, follow-up actions required
executionEvidence.rationale: Proves 'generate and disseminate internal system security alerts, advisories, and directives, as necessary' per 03.14.03.b

executionEvidence.name: Security Directive Implementation Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: directive received, issuing organization, required actions, implementation deadline, actual completion date, compliance status, or non-compliance notification sent
executionEvidence.rationale: Documents 'implement security directives in accordance with established time frames, or notify the issuing organization of the degree of noncompliance' (Rev 3 enhancement)

operationalActivities: Subscribe to security alert services from CISA, US-CERT, NSA, FBI, and relevant ISACs
Subscribe to vendor security bulletins for all software and hardware in use
Monitor security alert feeds daily for new advisories and directives
Review and assess relevance of incoming alerts within 24 hours of receipt
Generate internal security bulletins when external threats affect organizational systems
Disseminate internal security alerts to relevant personnel within defined timeframes
Track security directive compliance and maintain status dashboard
Implement critical security directives within timeframes specified by issuing organization
Notify issuing organizations when directives cannot be fully implemented with justification
Maintain repository of all alerts, advisories, and directives received and actions taken

policies.name: System Monitoring and Intrusion Detection Policy
policies.description: Policy governing continuous monitoring of systems to detect attacks, unauthorized connections, and unusual activities
policies.rationale: NIST 03.14.06 requires 'monitor the system to detect attacks and indicators of potential attacks' and 'unauthorized connections' necessitating comprehensive monitoring policy

policies.name: Security Operations Policy
policies.description: Policy defining security operations center (SOC) functions, monitoring objectives, alert escalation, and incident response integration
policies.rationale: Discussion states 'monitoring objectives may guide determination of the events' requiring policy-level definition of what to monitor and why

procedures.name: Security Event Monitoring Procedure
procedures.description: Process for real-time and periodic review of audit logs, security events, and system activities to detect attacks and unauthorized use
procedures.rationale: Control requires 'monitor the system' and 'identify unauthorized use of the system' which needs documented monitoring procedures

procedures.name: Intrusion Detection and Prevention System (IDS/IPS) Management Procedure
procedures.description: Process for deploying, configuring, tuning, and maintaining IDS/IPS at strategic locations including system boundaries and near critical assets
procedures.rationale: Discussion states 'system monitoring capability is achieved through variety of tools including intrusion detection systems' requiring IDS/IPS management procedures

procedures.name: Network Traffic Analysis Procedure
procedures.description: Process for monitoring inbound and outbound communications traffic to detect unusual patterns, data exfiltration, or command-and-control communications
procedures.rationale: NIST 03.14.06.c explicitly requires 'monitor inbound and outbound communications traffic to detect unusual or unauthorized activities or conditions'

procedures.name: Security Alert Triage and Investigation Procedure
procedures.description: Process for triaging monitoring alerts, investigating potential incidents, escalating confirmed threats, and documenting findings
procedures.rationale: Rev 3 adds requirement to 'analyze detected events and anomalies' requiring systematic investigation procedures

executionEvidence.name: Daily Security Monitoring Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: security events monitored, alerts generated, attacks detected, unauthorized connection attempts, investigation outcomes, incidents escalated
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates 'monitor the system to detect attacks and indicators of potential attacks' on continuous basis; daily reporting aligns with 24x7 SOC operations

executionEvidence.name: Weekly Intrusion Detection Summaries
executionEvidence.description: Summary reports showing: IDS/IPS alerts by severity, attack types detected, source IP analysis, blocked attack attempts, false positive rates, tuning actions taken
executionEvidence.rationale: Proves 'system monitoring capability achieved through intrusion detection systems' is operational per discussion guidance

executionEvidence.name: Network Traffic Anomaly Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: baseline traffic patterns, detected anomalies, unusual outbound connections, data transfer spikes, suspicious destinations, investigation findings
executionEvidence.rationale: Documents 'monitor inbound and outbound communications traffic to detect unusual or unauthorized activities' including 'unauthorized export of information' per discussion

executionEvidence.name: Unauthorized Connection Detection Logs
executionEvidence.description: Logs showing: unauthorized connection attempts, source/destination, blocked connections, successful unauthorized access, remediation actions, user notifications
executionEvidence.rationale: Proves detection of 'unauthorized connections' as required by 03.14.06.a.2 including network, remote, and local connections per discussion

executionEvidence.name: Security Analytics and Event Correlation Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: events analyzed, correlation analysis performed, attack patterns identified, threat intelligence integration, risk scoring, recommended actions
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates 'analyze detected events and anomalies' requirement added in Rev 3; shows sophisticated monitoring beyond simple alerting

executionEvidence.name: Monitoring Coverage Assessment Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: systems under monitoring, monitoring tool deployment locations, coverage gaps, remediation plans, monitoring effectiveness metrics
executionEvidence.rationale: Validates monitoring devices deployed at 'strategic locations including selected perimeter locations and near server farms' per discussion guidance

operationalActivities: Deploy IDS/IPS sensors at network perimeter and near critical system infrastructure
Configure SIEM to aggregate logs from all systems for centralized monitoring
Monitor security events 24x7 through Security Operations Center or equivalent
Review audit logs daily for signs of attacks or unauthorized activity
Analyze network traffic patterns to establish baselines and detect anomalies
Investigate all high-priority security alerts within 1 hour of detection
Block unauthorized connection attempts automatically via firewall integration
Correlate security events across multiple systems to identify attack patterns
Tune IDS/IPS rules quarterly to reduce false positives and improve detection
Generate weekly summary reports of monitoring activities and findings
Escalate confirmed security incidents to incident response team immediately
Review and update monitoring objectives annually based on threat landscape changes

policies.name: Information Retention and Disposition Policy
policies.description: Policy governing how long CUI and organizational records are retained, where they are stored, and how they are disposed of in accordance with legal and regulatory requirements
policies.rationale: NIST 03.14.08 requires 'manage and retain CUI in accordance with applicable laws, Executive Orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, guidelines' necessitating comprehensive retention policy

policies.name: Controlled Unclassified Information (CUI) Handling Policy
policies.description: Policy defining CUI categories, marking requirements, storage locations, access restrictions, and lifecycle management
policies.rationale: Control requires management of 'CUI within the system and CUI output from the system' which needs policy defining what CUI is and how to manage it

policies.name: Records Management Policy
policies.description: Policy aligning with NARA guidance on federal records retention schedules and disposition authorities
policies.rationale: Discussion explicitly states 'NARA provides federal policy and guidance on records retention and schedules' requiring organizational policy alignment

procedures.name: CUI Identification and Classification Procedure
procedures.description: Process for identifying information that qualifies as CUI, applying appropriate CUI markings, and documenting CUI inventory
procedures.rationale: Cannot manage and retain CUI without first identifying it; control requires managing 'CUI within the system' implying documented identification process

procedures.name: Information Retention Schedule Procedure
procedures.description: Procedure documenting retention periods for different information types based on legal, regulatory, and operational requirements including NARA schedules
procedures.rationale: Control requires retention 'in accordance with applicable laws, Executive Orders, directives, regulations' which must be documented in retention schedules

procedures.name: CUI Disposition and Sanitization Procedure
procedures.description: Process for disposing of CUI when retention period expires including secure deletion, media sanitization, and disposal certification
procedures.rationale: Discussion warns 'retaining CUI on nonfederal systems after contracts concluded increases attack surface' requiring documented disposal process

procedures.name: CUI Storage Location Management Procedure
procedures.description: Process for documenting where CUI is stored (systems and physical locations), restricting storage locations, and updating inventory as CUI moves
procedures.rationale: Control requires managing 'CUI within the system and CUI output from the system' implying need to track CUI locations throughout lifecycle

executionEvidence.name: Annual Records Retention Schedule Review
executionEvidence.description: Documentation showing: current retention schedules, alignment with NARA guidance, legal/regulatory requirement citations, schedule updates, approval signatures
executionEvidence.rationale: Proves retention schedules align with 'applicable laws, Executive Orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, guidelines' and are kept current

executionEvidence.name: CUI Inventory and Location Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: CUI categories present, systems storing CUI, physical locations, access control measures, marking compliance, responsible data owners
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates 'manage CUI within the system' including knowing where CUI exists and who is responsible for it

executionEvidence.name: Information Retention Compliance Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: information retained per schedule, retention periods met, overdue dispositions, legal holds preventing disposal, compliance percentage
executionEvidence.rationale: Proves information is 'retained in accordance with operational requirements' and retention schedules are being followed

executionEvidence.name: Secure Disposal Certificates
executionEvidence.description: Certificates showing: information/media disposed, disposal method (shred/wipe/degauss), disposal date, authorized disposal provider, chain of custody, destruction verification
executionEvidence.freshnessThreshold: N/A - maintained permanently as proof of proper disposal
executionEvidence.rationale: Addresses discussion concern about 'retaining CUI after contracts concluded increases attack surface' - proves proper disposal when retention not required

executionEvidence.name: CUI Post-Contract Disposal Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: contracts concluded, CUI associated with contract, disposal actions taken, disposal completion dates, verification of complete removal
executionEvidence.rationale: Directly addresses discussion point: 'retaining CUI on nonfederal systems after contracts or agreements have concluded increases attack surface'

operationalActivities: Maintain current records retention schedule aligned with NARA guidance and legal requirements
Identify and mark all CUI with appropriate distribution limitations and handling caveats
Maintain inventory of systems and locations where CUI is stored
Review retention schedule annually and update based on regulatory changes
Implement automated retention policies in document management and email systems
Monitor information retention compliance quarterly and remediate violations
Dispose of CUI securely when retention period expires using approved methods
When contracts conclude, identify all associated CUI and dispose within 90 days unless extended retention required
Implement legal hold procedures to prevent disposal when litigation anticipated
Obtain certificates of destruction for all CUI disposal activities
Train personnel on CUI marking, handling, retention, and disposal requirements annually
